name: Travelodge Corpus Christi Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here. we checked in for 1 night and ended up staying another night there. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Bar & Grill was so pleasant. i will recommend this hotel to family and friends.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Sharon & Charles Johnson
reviews.title: second home second famiy

reviews.text: this place is so stupendous not many places have atriums they have indoor pool that goes to the outdoor. I always stay here since my family and i decided to spend 4th of july we all got rooms here and some were there 1st and like i said this will not be the last time their staff are courteous and go over nd beyond to accomodate us.this place also has free breakfast. this estabishment is wonderful we enjoyed our nights here were great.
reviews.title: Very reasonable prices.....

reviews.text: This hotel had very reasonalbe prices and was under remodeling. Once ALL rooms have been upgraded it will be nice. The pool was a good size and they had washers/dryers onsite. There is also a restaurant in the hotel with a pool table as well as a gameroom that has ping pong table, air hockey and fooze ball game.
reviews.title: A wonderful suprise can't wait to go back..."

reviews.text: We read the reviews on line. The hotel was a gem. The staff was great. Polite, helpful, and they worked hard. The pool was great, the rooms are huge and the hotel is not too far from Port Aransas and the beaches. It is a old motel but the staff are working to update the amenities and they ask for your input. With an attitude like that this place can only get better.
reviews.title: Great Place for Families

reviews.text: Even if you need something cheap, if you're with you're family for enjoyment in Corpus, find something else! Unless you're a trucker or passerby that needs something fast and convenient, this hotel is horrible; it's a dump! The entry key locks do not work, so anyone from outside can enter at any time of the day or night and the hotel is not located in what seems like the safest place in town. Any carpeted area smell like someone left a wet rag in hot room and some parts hallways smelled like someone peed and nobody cleaned it up. It's hard to breath in the indoor pool area because of strong, clorine smell which carries in to the gym, lobby, and computer room that are connected to it. The rooms are a good size and the cleaning staff does an excellent job but even the best cleaning crew could not get that musty smell out of the room. There was bugs in our room all the time because of the gap in the door frame and the mosquitos are huge in South Texas! The free breakfast should be free because the food was inadequate at best. The coffee was watered down and the waffles and bagels tasted like they were left out for days. Even though it was free we didn't go back after the first day. We stayed here because we were traveling with three teenagers and needed something affordable in order to be able to enjoy Corpus. Next time I would rather cut our trip short by a few days and stay somewhere else for a higher price. I guess hotel/health inspectors have overlooked this place because surely it's not adequate for families with children. If anyone wrote a good review from it's probably because they work there and need to give the business a boost because in July 2010 when my family and I were there it was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at and we always stay at the most affordable hotels but this one gave affordable hotels a bad name!
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE

reviews.text: Airport shuttle was a necessity for me. The room was large, quiet, clean, and the price was right. Staff was friendly and helpful. Restaurant/bar on site, and the food was good and not overpriced. It was the least expensive hotel I found in Corpus with Airport shuttle. I have paid a lot more for a lot less.
reviews.title: I'd say it is a good value!

reviews.text: I am writiing a review for this hotel because it is next door to the "hotel" we actually chose,just by luck of the draw at 12am no less,to hopefully help someone avoid the dire mistake we made by doing so.VALUSTAY, is what they call the place next to this travelodge on corn products rd,and it is in NO WAY a VALUE!!!We checked in at midnight after looking for four hours for a hotel on father's day weekend,everything was either sold out or wayyy out of our budget.The guy that checked us in, though courteous enough seemed like he was very nervous,and the informal security guard was overly excited about us being there,but we were so tired we didn't think badly of it at the time.Once in our room,which on the surface was adequate enough, we noticed the tv wasn't working properly,only a couple of channels actually came through.The room was cool when we got in but the temperature fluctuated througout the night though we never thouched the thermostat.There were no bad smells but the sheets didn't look all that clean,there was graffiti everywhere,the door didn't lock properly and my oldest daughter said she witnessed a "horse roach" marching down the hallway.When my younger one went to wash her hands in the sink she was nearly scalded,the water had only one temperature,it was boiling hot!!!The worst of the worst for me though, was the horrible intrusion we had the next morning when the housekeeper proceeded to literally bust into our room at 9:45am!!!!She had been making alot of noise down the hall,as we were all trying to sleep, then she unexpectedly came banging on our door with some sort of metal object,then before we even had time to get out of the bed, much less get clothes on to answer the door, she busted in and started yelling across the room as to whether or not we would be checking out!!I was horrified and seriously pissed,I thought my teenager was going to attack!!I immediately called the office only to end up speaking to someone who obviously couldn't have cared less if the maid had seen us butt naked and had NO appologies for us, only a demand that we "better be out of the room by noon or we would have to pay"!That was all it took for me, I was outta there for sure!I will be reporting them to the better business bureau and the chamber of corpus.Please don't make a huge mistake, just pick the one next door.
reviews.title: DO NOT MAKE OUR MISTAKE!!

reviews.text: Inexpensive but it's a Scary Place!!!! Dirty and very badly maintained!!!! Dead roaches in the rooms.Lighting in the hallways was dark and gloomy. Hallway carpets were repaired with duct tape!!! Security key-card doors where broken!!!! I don't recommend this place to anyone!!!!
reviews.title: Skip It!

reviews.text: We pickde this place randomly because it was just off the interstate. Te price was decetn, under $60, and the staff was nice. But the room smelled musty or moldy. The worst part was the ROACHES. I must have seen 6 in our room the one night we stayed there. I would not stay again even for free.
reviews.title: Watch out for the Roaches!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I took a trip to Corpus over Memorial Day weekend and stayed at the Travelodge since most places right next to the beach were either waaaaay too expensive or sold out. I have to say, this was a great deal for the money we spent. It was $59/night and included free breakfast. Only about 5-10 minutes to the beach and downtown area. Staff was very pleasant and the room was nice. Cool pool, too-- you could swim from the inside under a wall to the outside. Highly recommend if you're young and on a budget or have a family.
reviews.title: Great rate, not too far from the beach!

reviews.text: We stayed here a year ago and it was in poor shape. But this year they have new paint, landscaping, new carpet and an awesome new game room for the kiddos. It was totally worth comeing back!
reviews.title: It was totally different from last time

reviews.text: the staff was very friendly and made us feel very comfortable the manager greeted us and made us feel welcome the pool was clean and beautiful the only thing bad was the bathroom need to be swept and mopped good and i traveled with family and friends so me and my 2 small children slept in one queen size bed and over the next 2 days we had a very ittchy rash all over our arms and chest and when we went to the doctors they said we caught scabies im thinking it might a been from the bed and sheets they looked dirty and didnt smell clean maybe it was over looked
reviews.title: it was a nice relaxing time

reviews.text: Your tip dont stay Roaches around and crawling on breakfast, molded shower curtains, bullet holes on glass doors, all cartoon channels dont work,smells lke urine in the room, breakfast disgusting waterd down gravy, the never clean the pool.
reviews.title: Run for your life.

reviews.text: This is a warning to those that plan to stay for the first time, "DON'T" !
reviews.title: stay sucked

reviews.text: I really HATED this place! I had trouble making reservations--told to call back in a half hour as they were too busy. Then had my name and number taken and no one called me back. I stuck with this place because of the recent positive reviews on tripadvisor and price and rewards deal--WRONG!
reviews.title: Felt Unsafe!

reviews.text: I arrived about 8:30 pm in the middle of the week. The desk was surrounded by a loud crowd of people three people deep reporting all sorts of problems from electrical outlets that don't work to lack of towels. Staff was yelling, too, about the LIST of people still needing help. Despite the reservation I made, I ended having to yell a lot of personal information to one of the rude women behind the counter--unsettling.
reviews.title: Unlikely to return unless free

reviews.text: The room was unclean--roach on its back (at least it was dead, I guess), brown stuff on the walls in the bathroom (tried not think about what that could be), stained up towels, and the coffee pot was icky. There was this overwhelming perfume smell in the air and on ALL linens.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: Biggest problem, LOUD MEN up and down the halls all night. Drunk, I presume. DID NOT FEEL SAFE HERE!!!!
reviews.title: STAY AWAY! this place is run down.

reviews.text: No microwave in room--my fault--I should have asked at check-in (however I was rattled by the whole atmosphere of the place). I was scared to walk around outside alone what with the other trashy "guests." And I did not want to deal with more rude staff!
reviews.title: Why it's the only hotel I will stay at in Corpus Christi

description: Built as a Hilton, this hotel has the character and ambiance of the 1970s. All rooms are 13x26 (338 sqft) making them some of the largest standard rooms in Corpus Christi. Reinvesting almost a million dollars in the exterior and the interior, the hotel has undergone significant renovation to provide comfort and security to the guests. Amenities include free breakfast, indoor-outdoor swimming pool, gazebo, well equipped exercise room, business center, restaurant bar and grill (with a free drink coupon every evening), game room, glass enclosed atrium for up to 250 guests, and more. The large parking lot is convenient for tour buses, recreational vehicles, trucks, and any oversize vehicles. We offer shuttle services to the airport and locations around the city at reasonable rates. Room types available include standard single king and full two bed double, plus kitchenettes, jacuzzi rooms, and two-room suites. We also have a few PET rooms and these must be reserved by call directly to the hotel to ensure availability. A $10/day additional charge is applicable for Pet Rooms. We care about the safety and security of our guests and have multiple closed circuit cameras plus security guard for the premises.
